page.title: 02AGRICULTURE
page.content: This block contains a limited area for farming, the main crop grown being sugar beet which is taken for proces- sing to Ipswich Sugar Beet factory. Some potatoes are grown; these go either to vegetable markets or to fro- zend food processors, others are for consumption by the Prison Service at Hollesley Bay Borstal Institution. Turnips are grown for sheep feed, and some wheat which is primarily for pig feed, the remaining being sold for malting at Ipswich, Newmarket and Stowmarket. The Prison Service have a herd of cows on land in the area, the milk being used by the Borstal for their own consumption.
